eadid.publicid: PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Karl August Wittfogel Papers)//EN" "reg_049.sgm"

titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Karl August Wittfogel papers, 1728-1992
titlestmt.author: Processed by Linda Bernard and Katherine Reynolds; machine-readable finding aid created by Xiuzhi Zhou

publicationstmt.p: Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid derived from Word-11, a Unix VAX-specific word processing program. [Date of source: 1992.]

change.item: Descriptions of reformatted audiovisual items updated
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Karl August Wittfogel Papers)//EN" "reg_049.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.head: Descriptive Summary

physdesc.label: Collection Size
physdesc.extent: 408 manuscript boxes, 11 card file boxes, 2 oversize boxes, 6 album boxes, 61 envelopes, 1 oversize folder, 15 microfilm reels, 1 videotape cassette, 2 phonorecords, 19 slides

did.abstract: Speeches and writings, memoirs, correspondence, notes, studies, reports, printed matter, and audiovisual materials, relating to the history of China from ancient times to the twentieth century; the development of Chinese studies in the West; the concept of an Asiatic mode of production; and the history of German, Russian, Chinese and international communist movements. Includes some papers of Esther Schiff Goldfrank and G. L. Ulmen.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Karl August Wittfogel papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1966.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Woltersdorf, Germany
Joined the German youth movement Wandervogel
Drafted, German Army Signal Corps
Joined the Unabhangige Sozialdemokratische Partei
Teacher, Volkshochschule Schloss Tinz, Tinz, Germany
Joined the Kommunistische Partei Deutschlands

Married Rose Schlesinger
Author, Rote Soldaten: Politische Tragodie in 5 Akten

Author,
Der Mann, der eine Idee hat
Die Mutter, Der Fluchtling
Vom Urkommunismus bis zur proletarischen Revolution
Die Wissenschaft der burgerlichen Gesellschaft: Eine marxistische Untersuchung
Author, Wer ist der Dummste?

Author,
Geschichte der burgerlichen Gesellschaft: Von ihren
Anfangen bis zur Schwelle der grossen Revolution
Der Wolkenkratzer: Amerikanischer Sketch
Author, Die spannenden Abenteuer des 12 jahrigen Freiheitshelden Antonio Mascaro im Bauernaufstand zu Mallorka
Cultural editor, Die Rote Fahne
Research associate, Institut fur Sozialforschung, Universitat Frankfurt, Germany
Author, Das erwachende China: Ein Abriss der Geschichte der gegenwartigen Probleme Chinas
Ph.D. in economics, Universitat Frankfurt
Author, Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft Chinas: Versuch der wissenschaftlichen Analyse einer grossen asiatischen Agrargesellschaft

Married Olga Joffe
Arrested; spent nine months in prison and in three
concentration camps
Left Germany for England and then the United States
Research associate, International Institute of Social Research, associated with and located on the campus ofColumbia University, New York City (formerly the Institutfur Sozialforschung)
Researcher in China
Author (under the pseudonym Klaus Hinrichs), Staatliches Konzentrationslager VII

Joined the Wider Quaker Fellowship
Broke with the Communist movement after the Nazi-Soviet Pact

Founder and director, Chinese History Project, Columbia University, New York City (co-sponsored by the Institute of Pacific Relations and the International Institute of Social Research, and after 1947, by the University of Washington and Columbia University)
Married Esther S. Goldfrank
Naturalized American citizen
Lecturer in Chinese, Columbia University, New York City
Associate Professor in International Studies, Columbia University, New York City
Associate Professor in the University Seminars, Columbia University, New York City
Acting professor of Chinese History, University of Washington, Seattle
Author (with Feng Chia-sheng), History of Chinese Society: Liao (907-1125)
Joined the American Committee for Cultural Freedom
Professor of Chinese History, University of Washington, Seattle
Subpoenaed to appear before the House Committee on Un-American Activities in executive session
Subpoenaed to appear before the Internal Security Subcommittee of the Senate Judiciary Committee in open session
Author, Oriental Despotism: A Comparative Study of Total Power
Author, From Marx to Mao: A Viewer's Guide
Distinguished Professor Emeritus, University of Washington, Seattle
Author, Beitrage zur marxistischen Asthetik
Died, New York City

scopecontent.p: Articles, clippings, legal documents, memoirs, memoranda and notes arranged by physical form
Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent
Reading notes and excerpts arranged alphabetically by topic
Articles, autobiographical notes, drafts of books, essays, index cards, memoirs, notes, speeches, and related research material and correspondence, arranged chronologically by title
Drafts of projected books, arranged alphabetically by title
Notes and correspondence arranged alphabetically by university
Pamphlets, clippings, articles, reports, and conference papers arranged alphabetically by topic
Prepared data sheets, correspondence, financial records, memoranda, notes, and published and unpublished writings arranged by physical form
(unsorted)
Published and unpublished writings, notes, correspondence, articles, and clippings arranged by physical form
Published and unpublished writings and correspondence arranged by physical form
Address and bibliographic, biographic, and reference note files arranged alphabetically by file
Phonotape reels of reminiscences by Wittfogel. In English

note.p: A transcription is available. In English

scopecontent.p: Microfilm copies of published articles and reference materials arranged alphabetically by subject
Phonorecords of Native American and Brazilian Indian music arranged alphabetically by title
Recording of lecture by Wittfogel on Oriental Despotism given in Germany
Placards announcing speeches, research materials for the Chinese History Project, and lithographs

physdesc.extent: 1704 prints, 4482 negatives, 24 albums, 19 slides / 61 envelopes, 6 album boxes, 1 slide box.

did.unittitle: 24 photo albums depicting people and places throughout Europe, Mexico and Peru.

scopecontent.p: Includes prints of Karl Wittfogel at his work.

did.unittitle: 150 prints of Karl Wittfogel in his youth.

scopecontent.p: Includes prints of his mother and father.
Includes 47 prints of Karl Wittfogel's mother and 4 prints of family graves.

did.unittitle: 54 prints, includes 39 prints of Olga Joffe (Wittfogel's second wife) and 15 prints of Wittfogel and Joffe.

scopecontent.p: Includes 22 prints of Esther Goldfrank (Wittfogel's third wife) and 21 prints of Wittfogel and Goldfrank.
Includes 13 prints of Wittfogel's personal effects and 53 prints of Wittfogel's years at the International Institut fur Sozialforschung an der Universitat Frankfurt am Main.

did.unittitle: 62 prints of identified friends and acquaintances.
188 prints of unidentified and identified scenes.

scopecontent.p: Includes 11 prints of Woltersdorf in envelope AS.

did.unittitle: 204 prints of Wittfogel's summer residence, Cornwall, N.Y.

scopecontent.p: Includes 3 prints of Wittfogel.

did.unittitle: 112 prints of Wittfogel's years in Seattle, WA.

scopecontent.p: Includes 13 prints of Wittfogel.

did.unittitle: 80 prints of Spain, great Britain and Europe (circa 1957)

scopecontent.p: Includes negatives.
Includes 19 prints of Wittfogel, and postcards sent by Yoshitaro Hirano with an image of the Kiso River, and from Wittfogel's mother, Johanne Wittfogel, from Lineburg, Germany.
Includes 1 print of Wittfogel.
Negatives included.

did.unittitle: 1 unidentified print of a school class photo.
2 prints of the 1927 Central Executive Committee of the Kuomintang, 1st Session.
16 negatives of Karl and Esther Wittfogel.
167 negatives of identified and unidentified people and scenes.

scopecontent.p: Includes 6 negatives of Esther Wittfogel and 7 negatives of Karl Wittfogel.

did.unittitle: 40 negatives of Bertram and Ella Wolfe at Cornwall, NY.
1428 negatives of Wittfogel's summer residence, Cornwall, NY.
